name: 許書涵
objective: Heat is fundamentally transported by a temperature gradient; it flows from a higher temperature region to a lower temperature one. An understanding of this process and its different mechanisms requires you to connect principles of thermodynamics and fluid flow with those of heat transfer. A study of this lecture will teach you how to model the concepts of different modes or mechanisms of heat transfer for practical engineering applications.
schedule:
week 1: introduction
week 2: The Heat Diffusion Equation
week 3: One-Dimensional Steady-State Conduction
week 4: One-Dimensional Steady-State Conduction
week 5: Thermal Resistance
week 6: Heat Transfer from Extended Surfaces
week 7: Two-Dimensional Steady-State Conduction
week 8: Two-Dimensional Steady-State Conduction
week 9: Midterm Exam
week 10: Transient Conduction
week 11: The Convection Boundary Layers
week 12: External and Internal Flow
week 13: Free Convection
week 14: Boiling and Condensation
week 15: Heat Exchanger
week 16: Heat Exchanger
week 17: Stefan–Boltzmann Law
week 18: Final Exam
materials: 課本：Fundamentals of heat and mass transfer. 7th ed., 2011, Bergman, Theodore L., and Frank P. Incropera., John Wiley & Sons.
